data.name: tbPageDesc_DescribeImagePage_Text_2
data.value: We need some more information to get underway.

data.name: tbPageDesc_CustomizeOSPage_Text
data.value: Begin customizing your Windows Phone image to make it unique.

data.name: ttDataAssetsSource
data.value: Assets can be chosen individually by specifying a file or as a group by specifying a directory.

data.name: txtCustomMessageBoxYesNoInstructions
data.value: Click Yes to continue, or else, click No to stay here.

data.name: txtInvalidArgument
data.value: Provide environment variables in form of (var1=value1;var2=value2;..) after '-Environment'

data.name: ttCOSMapData1
data.value: Map Data Assets are map files that get pre-populated to a predefined directory in the User Store.

data.name: dlgInstructionsCOSAddNewVariant
data.value: Specify the Name and at least on Target State Condition

data.name: txtMacroStillContainsTildeCharacter
data.value: The macro value must not contain '~' characters. Please try again.

data.name: tbSelectOption_MMOSImage_Text
data.value: A manufacturing test (MMOS) image includes manufacturing OS which is optimized to help with MMI testing on the factory floor.

data.name: tbSelectOption_BuildImage
data.value: Selecting this option will skip all customizations and go straight to building your Windows Phone image. The image may not have network functionality configured properly if you do this.

data.name: txtWPIDFilter
data.value: Windows Phone Image Designer Project Files|*.wpid.xml

data.name: tbSettingUp_HwDrvLocDesc
data.value: Confirm the location of the hardware component drivers you've downloaded as part of the BSP kit. These should contain the BSP and hardware component packages. This location is identified by the BSP.Config.XML file found under the BSP kit install folder.

data.name: chkCustomMessageNoShowAgain
data.value: Do not show this dialog again.

data.name: tbPageDesc_PickOutputLocationPage_Text
data.value: Where would you like to save the new image?

data.name: gbCustomize
data.value: Do you want to customize your phone image?

data.name: txtRestartCustomizationText
data.value: Would you like to go back to the start of the OS customization section? Any unsaved customization settings will be lost.

data.name: rbSelectOption_FlashImage_Text
data.value: Flash a Windows Phone image onto your phone

data.name: tbPathHasUndefinedMacro
data.value: This Settings Path is a template for creating additional settings by replacing the macro values in the path. Click the button below to define the macros and create the new Settings Path.

data.name: tbPageDesc_SelectImagePage_Text
data.value: Windows Phone supports multiple image type and each type serves a specific purpose during the phone development lifecycle. Pick the image type that best meets your needs.

data.name: ttCOSSettingsGroupAtomic
data.value: Settings are values that can override the default value and change the characteristics of an image. All settings under this path must be set.

data.name: msgCOSAddFileDuplicateFilenameError
data.value: Filename '{0}' has already been defined. Choose another Filename.

data.name: msgCOSAddNewTargetCondition
data.value: Specify the Condition name and value

data.name: tbPageDesc_CustomizationChoicePage_Text
data.value: Windows Phone supports a wide array of OS feature customizations to help you make your phone unique, such as adding custom wallpapers, applications, and ringtones, and modifying network settings.

data.name: txtInvalidBspConfigError
data.value:
The selected BSP config file is invalid. Please select a valid BSP config file to proceed.

data.name: tbPickOutputLoc_Replace_Text
data.value: Overwrite any image located at the current location.

data.name: tbSelectOption_selectTemplates
data.value: Selecting this option will allow you to pick multiple customization templates as a starting point.

data.name: msgCOSAddFileDuplicateFileNotFoundError
data.value: Filename '{0}' could not be found. Choose another existing Filename.

data.name: msgCOSEditTargetStateNoConditionSetError
data.value: You must set the Target State condition.

data.name: msgCOSAddVariantNoConditionsSetError
data.value: You must set at least one Target State condition.

data.name: tbSelectOption_TestImage_Text
data.value: You can use a test image to test the functionality of the OS and drivers on the phone. This image is unlocked and doesn't contain security enforcements. It includes Microsoft and Qualcomm test content.

data.name: ttCOSDataAssetsGroups
data.value: A Data Assets Groups are a set of files prepopulated in the User Store to a common location predefined by their type.

data.name: msgCOSCantRemoveDefaultVariant
data.value: The Default Variant can't be removed but you can clear it's values so it does nothing. Would you like to clear it's current settings?

data.name: rbSelectOption_BuildImage
data.value: No. I want to build my image.

data.name: txtFlashSuccess
data.value: Congratulations! Your device has been successfully flashed with the image you selected.

data.name: msgCOSBadPolicyPackagesError
data.value: There were bad policy packages ({0}) found in this image. Packages: {1}

data.name: tbSelectTemplates_SelectTemplate_Text2
data.value: You must add the templates in priority order.

data.value: Macro replacement required. Specify value for macro '{0}':

data.name: msgCOSAddNewSettingError
data.value: The Settings Path is not recognized by the policy defined in this image. No settings can be found.

data.name: tbFlashTxt_Text
data.value: Flash this image to a connected phone:

data.name: txtWpdkContentRootNotSet
data.value:
Environment variable WPDKCONTENTROOT is not set. This could happen if you launched ImageDesigner from a non-elevated command window.
Please do one of the following to fix this issue:
Launch from an elevated command prompt
OR
Launch by explicitly setting the variable on command line in the following form: ImageDesigner.exe -Environment WPDKCONTENTROOT=<value>

data.name: tbSelectOption_FlashImage_Text
data.value: Want to see how your Windows Phone image looks on an actual phone? Flash the image to find out.

data.name: msgCOSEditConditionsNoConditionsSetError
